text: [Music] my Jenny was a bit tough the economy was very bad in snubbull no jobs companies they were closing so I decided to come into South Africa looking for work [Music] my first chance was operating a forklift because that was the only available option I had previous experience from warm then I had some experience well the mechanical is just a little bit I could do all sort of small jobs so they realized as time went on that this guy can easily adapt now I'm a Pecos manager for the tomato pickers and the banana pick house I would say maybe Agriculture's one of the sector where it's had people from neighboring countries to come for employment with other places to find a job is very difficult so people will migrate with this area because they want to get better life for their families they want at least to get employment Africa is the youngest continent full of energy but at the same time is a continent with an enormous unemployment every year we would need to be generating 12 to 13 million of job for the new entrants into the market economy and Africa only generates 3 million this is again why I believe sustainable agriculture and limit smart agriculture and rural areas play a crucial role agriculture is I think it gives more jobs than any other jobs and people adapt easier to agriculture you see they learn quickly because it's there even in the rules if there are homes people still practice agriculture it at small bases most of the times they already know they work but they need to adapt a little bit to the circumstances of the hosting country capacity-building rates immediate benefits and a win-win situation both for migrants and for the hosting communities doesn't matter the girl black or white or ever to studying the farm because that's where there is an economy if you found then you're creating major opportunities for other people as well and then there is a program from the government that people must that be must be sent to other able to farm and all the days why we are now even giving a University of Milan so there is a need for us we keep on training people to be farmers one of the strengths is to provide the adequate skills to migrants or non migrants to rural communities in order to make agriculture modern they need to to learn new agricultural techniques they need to learn how to strain the value change of Agriculture that goes from the harvesting and the consumer so to reinforce agribusiness to reinforce harvesting transportation market opportunities we bring them to the land we started working with them with some time to refer to let them work May 4 2007 with method working by my hands myself then I was then a foreman supervisor managed and then now I'm happy to be production manager if if good potential they give you space they try to teach you so after a long term somebody decides to go back there with a lot of work experience we do train them to become farmers because we believe if we empower them then you will be empowering the nation a big issue for us is that rural areas have been neglected and that youth live in rural areas a growing population in Africa that is supposed to double by 2050 and that's why we're working constantly to make agriculture attractive to connect agriculture with rural and urban linkages to make agriculture part of the value chain to make subsistence agriculture closer to agribusiness to bring innovation to bring ideas and successes stories so other youth when watching the neighbor succeeding can also replicate with a good example when I came from to be frank I was just an ordinary guy but for now I have learned a lot I've got the 16 year old boy who is in Zimbabwe I send money every time there I - after three months for food for school fees everything you'll be going to university I'm not worried about paying for you I'll be able to do so so it changes somebody's lives you [Music]
